title: Memory Loss
description: Memory loss affecting daily life is often the first sign of dementia. This includes forgetting names, recent events, or repeatedly asking the same questions.

title: Confusion With Time
description: People with dementia may lose track of dates and events. They may feel unsure about where they are or how they arrived somewhere.

title: Difficulty Completing Tasks
description: Simple daily tasks like cooking, cleaning, or managing money become harder because of changes in memory and thinking ability.

title: Speech and Language Problems
description: Finding the right words, repeating phrases, or stopping mid-sentence are common signs as brain connections weaken.

title: Misplacing Items
description: People may put things in unusual places—clothes in the fridge, keys in a cooking pot—and struggle to retrace their steps.

title: Mood Changes
description: Dementia can cause sudden mood swings, irritability, anxiety, or withdrawal from family and community activities.

title: Personality Changes
description: A person may become suspicious, fearful, or confused about loved ones. These changes occur due to disruptions in brain function.

title: Poor Judgment
description: Common signs include giving away money, leaving the house unlocked, or making unsafe choices without realizing the danger.

title: Reduced Social Participation
description: People may avoid friends, stop attending church, or lose interest in hobbies they previously enjoyed.

title: Caregiver Burnout
description: Caring for a person with dementia is emotionally and physically demanding. Caregivers must rest, ask for help, and take breaks.

title: Healthy Eating
description: Nutritious foods—fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and water—can improve brain function and help manage symptoms.

title: Routine and Structure
description: A predictable daily routine reduces confusion, improves mood, and helps the person feel secure.

title: Physical Activity
description: Walking, light stretching, or gentle exercises help improve blood flow to the brain and reduce behavioral symptoms.

title: Dementia Is Not Witchcraft
description: Dementia is a medical brain condition, not a curse or spiritual punishment. Removing stigma helps families seek early support.

title: Early Medical Checkup
description: Visiting a clinic early helps diagnose the condition, rule out other illnesses, and start treatment that slows progression.
